chapterName: From War to Obedience in Spoleto
bookTitle: St. Francis of Assisi: Passion, Poverty and the Man who Transformed the Catholic Church

questions.question: How did Francis spend his time when he returned home after being in prison for a year?
questions.correctAnswer: Stayed home, slept often, began working for his father again
distractors: Traveled to Rome on pilgrimage
Trained with knights to prepare for another battle
Studied theology with local priests
Spent time in prayer at local monasteries
Helped rebuild damaged churches

questions.question: What did Francis' father do as Francis recovered from prison and began to dream of becoming a knight again?
questions.correctAnswer: He commissioned new armor and purchased a war horse
distractors: He sent Francis to train with a famous knight
He forbade Francis from fighting again
He arranged a marriage for Francis
He offered to buy Francis a position in the army
He paid for Francis to study warfare in France

questions.question: Where was Francis going and who was he going to be fighting for when he left Assisi with the other mercenaries?
questions.correctAnswer: He was heading to Apulia to join Sir Walter of Brienne to fight for the pope
distractors: He was going to Jerusalem to fight in the Crusades
He was traveling to Rome to join the papal guard
He was heading to Perugia for revenge against his captors
He was going to France to fight for the French king
He was traveling to Florence to defend the city

questions.question: What words did Francis' father say to him as he left Assisi that Francis might have ruminated on during his journey?
questions.correctAnswer: Do not disappoint me, you will bring honor to this family, our family is strong
distractors: Fight bravely, return with glory, make us proud
Remember your duty, serve God, protect the innocent
Be careful, stay safe, come home victorious
Prove your worth, earn your knighthood, show your courage
Trust in God, fight with honor, bring us fortune

questions.question: About how long would Francis' journey take?
distractors: About one week
About one month
About three weeks
About ten days
About four weeks

questions.question: What were Francis' thoughts on war the night they stopped in Spoleto?
questions.correctAnswer: Francis had previously wanted to become a knight, now he wasn't so sure. Was he supposed to kill? Was it just? What is peace?
distractors: He was excited and eager to prove himself in battle
He was worried about dying and never returning home
He questioned whether the pope's cause was worthy
He felt confident that God would protect him in battle
He wondered if he should have stayed in the merchant business

questions.question: What did Francis intuitively begin to think about as he ruminated on his journey and wondered if there was another way?
distractors: His thoughts turned to his mother's prophecy
His thoughts turned to the lepers he had seen
His thoughts turned to his father's business
His thoughts turned to his time in prison
His thoughts turned to the knights of Assisi

questions.question: Where does the voice tell Francis to go in the conversation Francis attributes to God?
distractors: To Rome to see the Pope
To Jerusalem on pilgrimage
To a monastery to pray
To the leper hospital to serve
To San Damiano to rebuild the church

questions.question: Why was the request to turn back distressing to Francis?
questions.correctAnswer: If he turned back and quit, everyone would judge him as a coward. It would bring shame to his family; he was concerned his father would disinherit him
distractors: He would lose his armor and expensive warhorse
His companions would feel betrayed and abandoned
He would miss the opportunity to earn knighthood
He had given his word to Sir Walter of Brienne
He feared God's punishment for disobedience

questions.question: What did Francis understand about the way he had been living his life after reflecting on Jesus' counterintuitive teachings?
questions.correctAnswer: He was living his life in search of earthly rewards with no understanding of heavenly glory
distractors: He was following his father's wishes instead of God's will
He was pursuing wealth when he should pursue poverty
He was seeking glory when he should seek humility
He was avoiding suffering when he should embrace it
He was serving himself when he should serve others

questions.question: After much introspection and discernment, what did Francis decide?
questions.correctAnswer: He decided to follow the way of the Gospel and turn back to Assisi
distractors: He decided to continue to Apulia but enter a monastery instead of fighting
He decided to complete his journey but renounce knighthood
He decided to go to Rome and seek the Pope's counsel
He decided to join a different religious order
He decided to serve as a healer rather than a soldier
